message: Give it a try and let me know what you think :)
I released a new Git tool last night, which mimics the GitHub for Mac workflow: https://github.com/kennethreitz/legit
Detailed Announcement: http://kennethreitz.com/legit-the-sexy-git-cli.html
At the moment, I don't foresee any integration, but that could change.
Maybe replicating `hub clone -p myrepo` would be helpful.
@locks, I'm not sure yet.
hi @kennethreitz, will legit have any github integration or you'll leave that for the github gem?
hm, I don't have a legit command on my terminal :/ already pip installed it
@locks I'm going to be releasing static binaries for 10.6 so it'll "just work"
@locks you might not have your python environment setup correctly.
I wholeheartedly endorse this product or service
@kennethreitz nice work, legit works great. Even on windows :).
OS X 10.6.7, 32bit

@kennethreitz I'd love the option to configure/suppress the colored output. Blue is very hard to read in my dark terminal setup and I'd imagine it's the same for yellow in a light setup.
mrtazz: you got it :)
@mrtazz: I just added it in. It'll be in the next release.
awesome, fast as usual :)
@mrtazz why don't you pick some better colors?  Solarized is damn nice: http://ethanschoonover.com/solarized
@tekkub works great for console2. Thanks for the hint.
@tekkub I tried it once for VIM, but I like molokai better. However it might work for me for console2 (where my colors are a bit suboptimal).

@agibralter support@github.com :)
I'm happy enough with normal Git. But might check out CLINT though. See if I need it for a new Python project.
@samjiman legit is a compliment to git, not a replacement.
@samjiman Clint is awesome, but i haven't written any docs yet :)

@kennethreitz  The configuration settings stuff in Clint looked useful, although my next project is going to be using MongoDB, so I could store the settings in there. Although I DBless mode could be implemented. So worth a look. :)
yay :D legit now installs on my machine, rock on
